properties.name: Clue #1
properties.description: Posted by Journalwebteam1) The new Matrix Hotel on 107th St. and 10oth Ave. is a breathe of fresh air — the renovation of a run-down hotel property into a hip neo-modernist gem. The lobby features a tall, sleek fireplace, complete with a cool waterfall. But can you tell me — what is the fireplace made from?

properties.name: Clue #10
properties.description: Posted by JournalwebteamEdmonton architect Gene Dub, who also designed our City Hall, recently won an urban design award for his glassy new housing development on 97th Street, right behind Canada Place. The apartment complex is built above a former Edmonton landmark. What was this site in its earlier life?

properties.name: Clue #11
properties.description: Posted by JournalwebteamThe Lodge Hotel and the Ernest Brown Block, on 96th St. and Jasper Ave., are being turned into an new museum and archives celebrating the history of Alberta’ Ukrainian community. According to the sign on the building, when did the Ernest Brown Block open?

properties.name: Clue #2
properties.description: Posted by JournalwebteamThe northwest corner of Jasper Ave. and 104th St., the former site of the Cecil Hotel, is a busy construction zone. A handsome new office and retail block will be opening soon, with a Sobey’s grocery store as its anchor tenant. What firm of architects is designing the building? And what does the Sobey’s block have in common with the old Birks Building across the street?

properties.name: Clue #3
properties.description: Posted by JournalwebteamJust north of the Sobey’s site (Jasper Ave. and 104th St) Langham Properties is building two condominium towers. What is that condo project called — and according to the placard on the property, what lofty record will the tower set?

properties.name: Clue #4
properties.description: Posted by JournalwebteamThe Bay LRT station, which was all but a ghost station for many years, is suddenly busy again. If you haven’t been there in awhile, get reacquainted with it. And tell me —what cool colour are the brick tiles that line the station walls?

properties.name: Clue #5
properties.description: Posted by JournalwebteamThe old Hudson’s Bay Building has a new life as Enterprise Square, the downtown campus of the University of Alberta. When you walk in the entry doors on 102nd Ave., one of the first offices you pass is the Office of Alumni Affairs. Peek in the office window and you’ll see a large green and gold crest hanging on the wall. What does the crest read — and what does it mean?

properties.name: Clue #6
properties.description: Posted by JournalwebteamThe U of A is sharing its space with the Art Gallery of Alberta, while the gallery awaits its new building. One of the AGA’s current exhibitions is a show called Fun House. Please name three of the Canadian artist whose works are included in the exhibit.

properties.name: Clue #7
properties.description: Posted by JournalwebteamWith apologies to the Village People — it’s fun to play at the YMCA. Drop by the new Don Wheaton Family Y, at 102nd Ave. and 102nd Street, and tell me this. For what family is the Y’s aquatic centre named?

properties.name: Clue #8
properties.description: Posted by JournalwebteamFor years, the ornate Hop’s Handbags building on Jasper Avenue sat vacant, a symbol of everything wrong with our downtown core. This fall, the old red Hop’s sign finally came down, and new tenants filled the building. Can you name one of the businesses that now occupies that space?

properties.name: Clue #9
properties.description: Posted by JournalwebteamThe new art gallery, designed by architect Randall Stout, is under construction at the northeast end of Churchill Square. Tell me — what colour is the construction crane on that site?
